channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15699] Can not sync AsyncFSWAL if no edit is appended
item.description: The problem is the txid that we assign to SyncFuture. In AsyncFSWAL, we will assign a zero txid if no edit is append, and it just equals to SyncFuture.NOT_DONE, so the sync request will never finish...
item.summary: Can not sync AsyncFSWAL if no edit is appended

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Change SyncFuture.NOT_DONE to -1 so it can accept a zero done txid.

Extract the tests from TestFSHLog, make a new class called AbstractTestFSWAL, and introduce a TestAsyncFSWAL which inherits AbstractTestFSWAL. Add a testSyncNoAppend UT to AbstractTestFSWAL.

Use a new eclipse and the import order is wrong...
This is the new patch which fixes import order.

+1 overall

lgtm


425	  public void testSyncNoAppend() throws IOException {

There seems to be no assertion in the above test.

You define NOT_DONE but set the doneTxid to something else while it is not done: i.e. NOT_DONE - 1. It is a little confusing.

Otherwise patch LGTM.

How you finding these nice issues in AsyncFSWAL Duo Zhang You running it?

The above comments explain why. We will call reset immediately after construction, and reset requires isDone() to be true so we need to set it to another value. The original implementation set NOT_DONE to 0 and this value to -1, I just change NOT_DONE to -1 and this value to -2. Let me see if I can remove the confusing logic.

I'm still working on make AsyncFSWAL as our default WAL implementation and found this when debugging the failure of region replica replication UTs. The non-primary replica will disable WAL but still call wal.sync at the end so we run into this bug there...

Thanks.

Ted Yu The bug here is that we will block on wal.sync forever without the changes in SyncFuture, so no assertions, just make sure the wal.sync can return normally.

Thanks.
Add a constructor for SyncFuture and do not call reset after the first creation.

-1 overall
